channel.title: Comments on: 5 Great Online Color Palette selection and design tools

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/706/comment-page-1#comment-2237">Gareth J M Saunders</a>.
I've tried that one in the past (and liked it!), but with the free ones that are available these days, I'm seeing no reason to buy.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gareth J M Saunders.

I’ve tried that one in the past (and liked it!), but with the free ones that are available these days, I’m seeing no reason to buy.

item.title: By: Gareth J M Saunders
item.dc:creator: Gareth J M Saunders
item.description: I use ColorImpact from Tiger Color (http://www.tigercolor.com/) which is a commercial Windows-only application and therefore obviously not free or Web-based, but worth checking out none-the-less.
item.content:encoded: I use ColorImpact from Tiger Color (http://www.tigercolor.com/) which is a commercial Windows-only application and therefore obviously not free or Web-based, but worth checking out none-the-less.
